resources.string: Notice:\nAs the start volume is set higher than the ringer volume, the ring tone will be played using the ringer volume.
To configure and use system profiles, turn profiles on.
Writing a profile to a NFC tag allows for tapping the tag to select the profile. Tapping a second time will select the previously selected profile.
This NFC tag refers to an unknown profile. Attaching this NFC tag to an existing profile will allow for selecting the profile in the future.
Enter a name for the new profile
Delete all user created profiles and app groups and restore them to default?
An active profile cannot be deleted
Enter a name for the new app group
When unlocked, include options in the power menu for rebooting into recovery or bootloader
Allowing applications to request root access is very dangerous and could compromise the security of your system!
Help make CyanogenMod better by opting into anonymous statistics reporting

Opting into CyanogenMod Statistics will allow non-personal data to be submitted to the developers of CyanogenMod to track unique installations across devices. The information submitted includes an unique identifier, which does not compromise your privacy or personal data. The data is submitted during each boot.\n\nFor an example of the data that is submitted, tap on Preview Data.

These settings are included for experimentation and any changes made to them have the potential to cause instability, crashes, data loss or hardware failures.\n\nWe request you do not file bug reports if any of these settings have been changed from the defaults.
Change CPU governor and clock speed
Restore the processor settings on boot
Restore the I/O scheduler settings on boot
Customize the usage of memory to alter system performance
KSM reduces physical memory requirements and improves performance
Purging of bitmap memory assets allows the freeing of more RAM when needed (requires reboot)
Better graphics performance, but lower quality and may cause visual artifacts (requires reboot)
Check for, view or install available updates
When Privacy Guard is enabled, the app will not be able to access personal data such as contacts, messages or call logs.
When enabling Privacy Guard for a built-in app, the app will not be able to access or provide personal data. This may cause other apps to misbehave.
Enable by default for newly-installed apps
Manage which apps have access to your personal data
No apps with relevant permissions are installed

In this screen you can choose for which apps Privacy Guard should be active by simply tapping on them. Selected apps will not be able to access your personal data, such as contacts, messages or call logs. Long pressing on an entry opens the app details screen for that app.\n\nBy default built-in apps are not shown. If you want to show them, select the respective option in the menu.
You don\'t have any blacklisted numbers. Add an entry by touching the Add (+) button.
To blacklist calls and/or messages from certain numbers, enable the blacklist.
Incoming calls and messages from phone numbers in the blacklist will be blocked
Don\'t block calls from private numbers
Don\'t block calls or messages from numbers not in the contact list
Block incoming %s from numbers not in the contact list
Use . as a wildcard and * for repetition. E.g. 123.* blocks numbers starting with 123 and .*123.* blocks numbers containing 123
Do you want to remove this blacklist entry?
Values higher than %1$d are not recommended
Launch the default music app when headset is connected
Display a notification when USB debugging is connected
Enable TCP/IP debugging over network interfaces (Wi-Fi, USB networks). This setting is reset on reboot

WARNING: When ADB over network is enabled, your phone is open for intrusions on all connected networks, including GSM data network!

Only use this feature when you are connected on trusted networks.

Do you really want to enable this function?
Intelligently vary the backlight brightness of the display and help maximize battery life
Apps can send %d messages in 30 minutes before requiring confirmation
Apps are not allowed to send any messages without confirmation
Change the password used for device encryption
Show status and navigation bar in lock screen during expanded desktop mode
Display the 3-dot overflow menu button within apps
The action overflow button may not be visible until apps are restarted
The action overflow button may not be hidden until apps are restarted
Pressing the home button will wake your device
Pressing the camera button will wake your device
A half press will keep the screen on only while the button is held down
When the screen is off, long pressing the camera key will play/pause current music track
Pressing either volume button will wake your device
When the screen is off, long pressing the volume keys will seek music tracks
Swap volume buttons when the screen is rotated
Enable \'wipe data\' and \'force close\' options in notification area and recent apps list
View or change the displayed buttons
View or change the order of the buttons
View or change the Brightness button modes
View or change the Sound button modes
Sets color for activated toggle icons
Sets color for not activated toggle icons
Pressing the headset button will launch voice controls
Lets you transfer any files between your computer and your SD card by mounting it as a flash device
Register for WhisperPush to enable encrypted SMS.

ART is not supported by CyanogenMod. This setting is included for experimentation only and has the potential to cause instability, crashes, data loss or prevent the proper boot of your device. Visit Introducing ART for more information.

We request you do not file bug reports if you have enabled ART as your runtime.

Are you sure you want to reboot to change runtime from %1$s to %2$s?
Download GPS assisted data only over Wi-Fi networks
View or change lock screen security, delay and timeout settings
Pressing the menu button unlocks the device
Pressing the home button unlocks the device
Pressing the camera button unlocks the device
Unlock automatically when the correct PIN/password is entered
Expand widgets when the screen is turned on
In vibrate mode, all notifications will vibrate regardless of individual app settings
Incoming notifications will softly vibrate during phone calls
Play sound when adjusting volume with volume rocker
Rescan media for the storage volume
View or change lock screen button actions
Are you sure you wish to reset AppOps counters?
Don\'t send touch events for navigation and status bar gestures to apps
Enable all apps to send SMS messages through Google Voice
